transportAdvice: Stuttgart has a well-developed public transit network including underground metro lines, trams, and buses that connect the city centre with major attractions and surrounding areas. Walking is practical within the city centre, though the hilly terrain can be challenging; taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold winter month with occasional frost and overcast skies; snow is possible but not guaranteed.
Still cold with lingering winter conditions, though daylight hours begin to increase noticeably.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and occasional showers as the landscape begins to green.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming trees and gardens, though rain showers remain common.
Warm and largely enjoyable with longer days, making it a good month for outdoor sightseeing.
Early summer is warm and lively, with occasional thunderstorms in the afternoons.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days and periodic summer thunderstorms.
Warm summer conditions continue, with occasional heat spells and afternoon thunderstorms possible.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and comfortable daytime temperatures ideal for exploring.
Autumn colours emerge across the surrounding hills and vineyards as temperatures drop steadily.
Cool and often grey with increasing rain; the famous Christmas markets begin to open late in the month.
Cold and festive with renowned Christmas markets drawing visitors; snow is possible but not reliable.
